description: The oldest of the four Vedas, consisting of hymns (suktas) dedicated to various deities. Composed between 1500-1200 BCE, it contains philosophical and cosmological insights.
The Veda of melodies and chants. Most of its verses are derived from the Rig Veda but set to musical notation for liturgical purposes.
The Veda of prose mantras and ceremonial formulas. It serves as a practical guidebook for priests performing ceremonial rites.
The Veda of everyday life, containing hymns, spells, and incantations. It deals with practical aspects of daily living and healing practices.
